channel.title: Golang programming tutorial
channel.description: Recent content on Golang programming tutorial

item.title: Deploy hugo blog using github actions
item.description: Introduction In the last post we created our new shiney hugo blog on our local machine, but we need a place to host it on the internet. And we want to make deploying it super easy, so that we don’t have to repeat any steps anytime. Create a new Organisation in github Create a new repository for our Live blog Create a Personal Access Token Create a repository for our blog source files Create a github action to deploy our blog

item.title: Introduction to Go
item.description: Introduction Go was designed at Google in 2007 by Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike and Ken Thompson. It was announced to the public in November 2009 Go is a statically typed, compiled language. It was aimed to improve programming productivity. It has syntactic similarity to C, but includes memory safety, garbage collection, static typing, readability and built-in concurrency support. It has simple, consistent features, which prefer maintainability over expressiveness. Why Go? It is Open Source, Free and Cross-platform.
